text: I think that, at least what i have heard from clients and other partners, the  benefits of themes outweight the initial added costs, but that might only apply for pages to a certain size and complexity!

in response to point 3) i would say that template packs enabled thoses without any coding knowledge to create page templates. Now that they are in HTML, people need to adjust, which is a good thing because that "blurry line" between what is "editor territory" and what "dev territory" is not so blurry now. For me it is pretty clear.
4) not sure if i am the only one but i am really impressed as to how much themes, the documentation and everything around it has matured in the last year!
In my opinion, the only thing that is really missing right now is support material in terms of  what can be done with the CMS from an Editor perspective.
Hey <@UBT0AHWLD> can you expand on the last comment above, what is it you would be looking for with this type of content/materials?

i think that a Video series that actually shows how to do basic stuff would be great, from an Editor perspective. The videos from HubSpot that i have seen are often "high level"  that give a genereal overview. Videos that cover things like:
1) how to create a CTA and what options do i have?
2) How to create a Landing Page / Website page and what are the differences ( in terms of  reporting for example)
3) What options do i have to import stuff
4) how to redirect a page
would enable editors to get more comfortable more quickly!
great comments!  and i am stealing them all

almost like a... HS CMS for Marketers video series? cc <@UNQ6UDGSJ>

Also, isn't there a cert like that? CMS for marketers? curious if that content is in there
There is <https://academy.HubSpot.com/courses/cms-for-marketers?library=true|one>! I know it doesn't touch on domains so that is a good call out. Domains can be scary.
Hi Mark, yes there certainly is already content about this there :slightly_smiling_face:.. i just think that some areas are covert too much high level
